title: Lewis Hamilton carries the scars of racist abuse, says Mercedes chief Toto Wolff
text:
Toto Wolff, the Mercedes team principal, has made the dramatic claim that Lewis Hamilton carries permanent scars from the racist abuse he experienced as a child. With his driver poised to become a six-time world champion in Sunday's Mexican Grand Prix, the Austrian argued that the prejudice Hamilton received in the junior karting ranks remained a central element of his psychological make-up today.

“When Lewis was younger, he was the only black kid among the white kids, and I know he was racially abused on the track,” Wolff said.

“If that happens to an eight-year-old, or a 10-year-old, it just leaves scars that will not go away. If as a child, you have to had to overcome abuse discrimination, on one side it makes you a stronger personality. But on the other it also leaves scars. Today, Lewis has a good and mature perspective, but the scars are certainly there. Those scars are a witness of having survived.”

Hamilton, as one of the few black drivers in an overwhelmingly white motorsport landscape, was a trailblazer from the moment he first enjoyed karting success. He has also made frequent pleas for Formula One to improve its work on diversity. When asked why he had been penalised by stewards at the 2011 Monaco Grand Prix, he joked, acidly: “Maybe it’s because I am black. That’s what Ali G says.”
description: Toto Wolff, the Mercedes team principal, has made the dramatic claim that Lewis Hamilton carries permanent scars from the racist abuse he experienced as a child.
